channel.title: My New Flash
channel.description:
[flash=200,200]http://annam225.ulmb.com/peterflash.swf[/flash]
Rate it.
I just started flash, and that's not it's original size...The original size 400x250 that's like 700x500

item.title: My New Flash
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Eclipse, he offered perfectly valid CC. If you want people to say OMG WOW HAX, go back to moparscape. Maybe they have the patience to wait a minute for something they don’t even want to see.

Read full topic

item.title: My New Flash
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I did resize my browser to about that size for the foreground before I looked at it, its quality wasn’t that good(not talking about the flash client’s quality such as HIGH-LOW)

eclipse245:

No I didn’t get any of it off Google. It’s all from planetrenders…

I didn’t specifically say you got it from google, it just seems like a generic source.

eclipse245:

Funny how you make everything so serious…

Criticism can be both positive and negative, and I aim for constructive criticism, therefore it is serious stuff, if you want to get better you need to know other’s opinions and consider them, that way you improve

Read full topic

item.title: My New Flash
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“eclipse245, post:3, topic:167615”]First of all…

Pretty sad you wrote so much…Because it seems as if you never read anything of what I wrote.

I said that the ORIGINAL SIZE is 400x250…usually when you upload it to places it gets doubled…Right now it’s 800x500. That explains the pixels.

Second Thing…

No I didn’t get any of it off Google. It’s all from planetrenders…

Third Thing…

Since I just got Flash CS3, 2 days ago, I was just testing how everything would work…I would NEVER put this flash on ANY website lol…

Funny how you make everything so serious…[/quote]
Nothing he said was bad, it was perfectly valid criticism.

Read full topic

item.title: My New Flash
item.dc:creator: @eclipse245 eclipse245
item.description:
@eclipse245 wrote:

First of all…

Pretty sad you wrote so much…Because it seems as if you never read anything of what I wrote.

I said that the ORIGINAL SIZE is 400x250…usually when you upload it to places it gets doubled…Right now it’s 800x500. That explains the pixels.

Second Thing…

No I didn’t get any of it off Google. It’s all from planetrenders…

Third Thing…

Since I just got Flash CS3, 2 days ago, I was just testing how everything would work…I would NEVER put this flash on ANY website lol…

Funny how you make everything so serious…

Read full topic

item.title: My New Flash
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

did you have to upload it to a server that makes you wait for a whole minute for it…?
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 24, 2007, 09:23:46 PM[/size][hr]ok, rating time,
2/10
Too pixle-ish
separate the effects from the test and make change the opacity according to its speed to look more like a good effect.
Background picture horrible
No sign of pre-loading
Better sword animation suggested
less of a generic sword sound
put some movement into it, such as the pixelated warrior in a standing stance breathing, but as far as I can tell you just found it on google and used it. You can find animated renderings out there.
put a smooth ease(a real one) on the text moving up/down to center
have a slight distraction in the background to fill in the void of space

Also please next time put on a site that doesn’t force us to wait like that.

Read full topic
